item.title: Add a prefix
item.description: Add a prefix ​â€‹ Before you start Cloudflare recommends that you switch any Advanced TCP Protection rules currently in mitigation mode to monitoring mode before adding a new prefix to Advanced TCP Protection. Refer to Rule settings for more information on execution modes. To add a prefix to Advanced TCP Protection: Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard External link icon Open external link and select your account. Go to Account Home > Network Security > DDoS > Advanced TCP Protection.

item.title: Add an IP or prefix to the allowlist
item.description: Add an IP address or prefix to the allowlistTo add an IP address or prefix to the Advanced TCP Protection allowlist: Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard External link icon Open external link and select your account. Go to Account Home > Network Security > DDoS > Advanced TCP Protection. Under General settings > Allowlist, select Edit. Enter a prefix and (optionally) a description in Prefix and Description, respectively. To exclude the current prefix from the allowlist instead of including it, uncheck the Enabled checkbox.

item.title: Create a rule
item.description: Create a ruleTo create a SYN flood rule or an out-of-state TCP rule: Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard External link icon Open external link and select your account. Go to Account Home > Network Security > DDoS > Advanced TCP Protection. Depending on the rule you are creating, do one of the following: Under SYN Flood Protection, select Create SYN flood rule. Under Out-of-state TCP Protection, select Create out-of-state TCP rule.

item.title: Exclude a prefix
item.description: Exclude a prefix or a prefix subsetTo exclude a prefix or a prefix subset from Advanced TCP Protection: Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard External link icon Open external link and select your account. Go to Account Home > Network Security > DDoS > Advanced TCP Protection. Add the prefix you previously onboarded to Magic Transit to Advanced TCP Protection. Add the prefix (or subset) you wish to exclude as a new, separate prefix in Advanced TCP Protection.
